20030101-d-01-17-03-PTRA.Narrative: JOB 181 HANDLING 51 CARS MOVING SOUTHWARD ON WEST MAIN YARD TRACK AT 10 MPH.  THERE WAS A PIPE CONTRACTOR UNLOADING PIPE FROM A RAILROAD CAR ON A TEAM TRACK NEXT TO WEST MAIN TRACK.  AS THE ENGINE STARTED PAST THE PIPE CAR BEING UNLOADED, THE OPERATOR UNLOADING THE PIPE, DROPPED PIECE OF PIPE WHICHSTRUCK THE ENGINE AS IT WAS PASSING BY.  THE OPERATOR FAILED TO FOLLOW PROPER PROCEDURE OF STOPPINGALL MOVEMENTS WHILE TRAIN IS PASSING BY AT THIS LOCATION.  THE OPERATOR OF PIPE UNLOADER WAS DRUG TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJUREIS BUT SUBSTATIAL DAMAGE TO ENGINE.

BNSF WAS NOTIFIED AND CALLED HULCHER TO SCENE TO P/U THE BORD CAR AND PLACE IT AWAY FROM THE MAIN TRACK FORTHE CAR DEPARTMENT TO REPLACE WHEEL.  THE BNSF USED ONE OF THEIR TRAINS TO PULL THE REAR OF THE TRAIN BACK FOR THE HULCHER TO REACH THE BORD CAR.  A DOGCATCH CREW WAS CALLED FOR 22:30-13 TO PULL THETRAIN TO ST. PAUL. I0303-d-01-17-03-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0303-d-01-17-03-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0303-d-01-17-03-PATH.Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0303-d-01-17-03-PATH.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 6:36PM A TRAIN STRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK WHILE PLATFORMING ON TRACK 1 AT THE HOBOKENSTATION.  THE COLLISION CAUSED THIRD RAIL POWER TO SHUT OFF.  POLICE WERE NOTIFIED TO RESPOND AS WELL AS HOBOKEN EMS.  THE CARS IN CONSIST WERE 808-827-857-627-656-147-619.  THE TRAIN TRAVELED 15 FEET BEYOND THE BUMPING BLOCK CAUSING EXCESSIVE DAMAGE TO THE DRAW HEADS, PLATFORM AREA AND CONSIST.  THE OPERATING CAR (808) NUMBER ONE TRUCK WAS RAISED 10 INCHES IN THE AIR, AND WAS BEING HELD UP BY THE PLATFORM.  THE ENGINEER STATES THAT HE WAS PROCEEDING AT A SUFFICIENTLY LOW SPEED.  HE APPLIED TWOPOINTS OF POWER BRIEFLY AFTER PASSING SIGNAL 98Z.  HE ALLEGED THAT HE APPLIED THE BRAKES BUT IT HADNO EFFECT.  HE ALLEGED THAT HE CONTINUED TO APPLY THE SERVICE BRAKE UNTIL EVENTUALLY PLACING THE BRAKE VALVE INTO THE EMERGENCY POSITION.  CAR WAS THEN TOO CLOSE TO THE BUMPING BLOCK.  SEVERAL PASSENGERS IN CAR 808 WERE INJURED INCLUDING A PASSENGER ON THE PLATFORM.  CAR EQUIPMENT DIVISION GAVE THEEQUIPMENT, ONCE RE-RAILED A STANDING BRAKE TEST.  THE EMERGENCY BRAKE AND PILOT VALVE DEAD MAN FEATURE WERE ALSO TESTED.  ALL OPERATED AS DESIGNED.  TOTAL DAMAGE TO BOTH EQUIPMENT AND TRACK STRUCTUREWERE APPROXIMATELY $127,742.  THE CREW WERE SENT FOR `TOX BOX` TESTING AT CHRIST HOSPITAL.  ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.
FINAL DETERMINATION WAS AS FOLLOWS:  THE ESTIMATED SPEED OF THE CONSIST AT THETIME OF IMPACT WAS CALCULATED TO BE 6 MPH, WHICH WAS BELOW THE SPEED LIMIT FOR ENTERING A STATION.
